page.title: 12VILLAGE HALL AT ESKDALEMUIR
page.content: Midway between the northern and southern boundaries of Eskalemuir parish stands the village hall. Built by ex-servicemen of the first world war and land given by the Duke of Buccleuch it is named the Ex-Service Mens Public Hall . It is a central meeting place for the various organisation in the valley, the Community Council, S.W.R.I., Womens Guild of the Church of Scotland and Carpet Bowling Club. It is a recreation centre used for bowling tornaments, karate, childrens playgroups. Special trestles support the bowling boards which are loaned to act as tables when large functions are held. They also do duty as stalls for the" Sales of Work" held annually in aid of church and hall funds alternately.
